alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; East Baton Rouge; East Feliciana; Eastern Ascension; Iberville; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; St. Helena; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana; Western Ascension (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 4:41AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Ascension, southeastern West Feliciana, West Baton Rouge, St. Helena, Livingston, East Feliciana, Iberville, northwestern Tangipahoa and East Baton Rouge Parishes, southwestern Pike and southeastern Amite Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 440 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wakefield to near Jackson to near Zachary to 9 miles west of Bayou Sorrel. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Zachary, Baker, Denham Springs, Gonzales, Plaquemine, Port Allen, Jackson, Clinton, Greensburg, Amite, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Walker, Amite City, Addis, Brusly, Kentwood, White Castle and Livingston. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 138 and 185. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 32. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 40 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
